Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
this class represent camera by location
and directions toward, right and up to the scene that lives in a virtual view plane.
The view plane is represent by height and wight
Author:
Noam Shushan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Point3D _centerPoint
    the point on the center of the view plane
    private double _distance
    the distance from the camera to the view plane
    private double _height
    the height of the view plane
    private Point3D _p0
    the location of the camera
    private Vector _vRight
    the the normal in the right direction
    private Vector _vTo
    the the normal in the toward the scene
    private Vector _vUp
    the normal in the up direction
    private double _width
    the width of the view plane
    private static double BEAN_RADIUS_FOR_ANTI_ALIASING
    the radius of the random point to create around
    the center point of the pixel in the view plane
    to calculate the average color of point on some geometry
    as part of anti aliasing improvement

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D p0, Vector vTo, Vector vUp)
      constructor for camera
      Parameters:
      p0 - the location of the camera
      vTo - the direction to the view plane
      vUp - the direction up
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vTo and vUp is not orthogonal

  • Method Details

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      construct ray through a pixel in the view plane nX and nY create the resolution
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in the width of the view plane
      nY - number of pixels in the height of the view plane
      j - index row in the view plane
      i - index column in the view plane
      Returns:
      ray that goes through the pixel (j, i) Ray(p0, Vi,j)

    • constructBeanOfRaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructBeanOfRaysThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, int numOfRays)
      construct bean of rays through a pixel in the view plane nX and nY create the resolution
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in the width of the view plane
      nY - number of pixels in the height of the view plane
      j - index row in the view plane
      i - index column in the view plane
      numOfRays - the number of rays to construct
      Returns:
      list of rays that start in the position of the camera and gos to the pixel

    • getCenterOfPixel

      private Point3D getCenterOfPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      get the center point of the pixel in the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in the width of the view plane
      nY - number of pixels in the height of the view plane
      j - index row in the view plane
      i - index column in the view plane
      Returns:
      the center point of the pixel

    • moveCamera

      public Camera moveCamera​(Point3D newPosition, Point3D newPointOfView)
      moving the camera from her location
      Parameters:
      newPosition - the new position of the camera
      newPointOfView - new point of view of the camera
      Returns:
      the new camera from the new position to the new point of view

    • rotateCamera

      public Camera rotateCamera​(double theta)
      Rotate the camera by rotating the vectors of the camera directions
      According the Rodrigues' rotation formula
      Parameters:
      theta - angle theta according to the right hand rule in degrees
      Returns:
      this camera after the rotating

    • rotateCamera

      private Camera rotateCamera​(double theta, Vector k)
      Rotate the camera by rotating the vectors of the camera directions
      According the Rodrigues' rotation formula
      Parameters:
      theta - angle theta according to the right hand rule in degrees
      k - axis vector for the rotation
      Returns:
      this camera after the rotating

    • setViewPlaneSize

      public Camera setViewPlaneSize​(double width, double height)
      set the view plane size
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the view plane
      height - the height of the view plane
      Returns:
      this camera (like builder pattern)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height equal to 0

    • setDistance

      public Camera setDistance​(double distance)
      set the distance from the camera to the view plane
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance
      Returns:
      this camera (like builder pattern)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if distance = 0
